str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take note of, perceive, consider carefully, discern, detect, make account of. From kata and noieo; to observe fully.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Lit. and met: I put to death, make as dead; I render weak, impotent. From nekros; to deaden, i.e. to subdue.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
Genitive case of an indefinite pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place, somewhere, i.e. Nearly.
A hundred years old. From hekaton and etos; centenarian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) putting to death, (b) dead or lifeless condition. From nekroo; decease; figuratively, impotency.
Sarah, wife of Abraham. Of Hebrew origin; Sarra, the wife of Abraham.
The womb. From meter; the matrix.
